page.title: 08FARMING 2
page.content: Only 2 or 3 farmers now produce milk, sending it to the Milk Marketing Board or selling it retail. Others have suckler calves which run with their mothers. Milk cows are mainly Fries- ian.Suckler calves include pure Her- efords and Hereford-,Charolais-, Lim- ousin- and Friesian- crosses. Artif- icial insemination is used on some farms. Calves are sold at 8mths-1yr old, store cattle at 18mths-2yrs. At St.Johns Chapel Auction Mart in 1985 a Charolais cross heifer calf made Â£750 and a first prize bullock Â£445. Buyers came from Bishop Auckland, Durham, Cleveland and York. Silage and hay are made for winter fodder. Most farmers now favour giant bales wrapped in plastic and stored outside. Hay making is highly mechanised. Many farmers use 3 wheeled Honda motor- cycles to travel about their land.
